review_blob: This beer was indeed a treat and pleasure to drink. Aroma was indeed Cinnamon, nutmeg and spice. Chilled and poured into a snifter, at first taste the spices and pumpkin flavor were definitely present and blended very well not to potent and overwhelming and not to subtle and weak. As the beer started to warm a spiced rum taste started to appear and lingered on the palate. Again I highly enjoyed this beer and will be indulging in this while it lasts! Cheers

This beer is a lot ligther tasting then most brown ales Ive tried.Poured out of a bottle and into a nonic, the nut aroma as well as taste is present, and has almost a lingering maple flavor towards the end. Cheers!
beer_name: Woodstock Inn Pigs Ear Brown Ale

review_blob: Too sweet. This beverage was rich in color and did taste like raspberry as promised. However the whole time it felt like I was drinking a Mikes hard or a raspberry puree. The sugar was way to much to handle in this ale and I was not impressed.

The smell of roasted malts as soon as I poured the beer. A suttle smoked flavor with lingering hint of coffee. 45 IBU and coming in at almost a 40 for SRM. This beer lives up to its name as Dark,Rich,and Sexy!Cheers.
This beer is tasteful just like a Brown ale should be. A little bitter but none the less a tasty beer. With 30 IBU and 25 in SRM which brings the color between a ruby brown and deep brown.
